summary: This is a compilation of news clips from March 5, 2020, covering multiple Southern District of New York cases. It includes updates on the Jeffrey Epstein victims' compensation fund, a lockdown at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), guilty pleas by a correctional officer for sexual abuse, and cases involving Bernard Madoff, Joshua Schulte, Lawrence Ray, Harvey Weinstein, and others.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased financier whose estate is involved in setting up a victims' compensation fund. He died by suicide in the MCC while awaiting trial.

persons.name: Denise George
persons.context: AG who placed liens on Epstein's assets but has agreed to release them to allow a victims' compensation fund to proceed, pending certain enhancements.

persons.name: Carol Thomas-Jacobs
persons.context: Filed court papers stating the AG's office intends to permit release of estate assets for the victims' fund.

persons.name: William Blum
persons.context: Represented the estate, blamed AG George for impeding the payout process, and stated co-executors hope to reach an agreement.

persons.name: Richard Kahn
persons.context: Named as a co-executor of Jeffrey Epstein's estate.

persons.name: Darren Indyke
persons.context: Named as a co-executor of Jeffrey Epstein's estate.

persons.name: David Patton
persons.role: Chief of the Federal Defenders Office in Manhattan
persons.context: Criticized the MCC lockdown for denying inmates access to lawyers and constitutional rights, and claimed conditions were inhumane.

persons.name: Colin Akparanta
persons.context: Pleaded guilty to sexually abusing at least seven female inmates between 2012 and 2018, and smuggling contraband.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.context: Issued statement on Akparanta's guilty plea, emphasizing prosecution of correctional officers who engage in criminal conduct. Also mentioned in the Antonio Nikc tax case.

persons.name: Bernard Madoff
persons.context: Orchestrator of a massive Ponzi scheme; prosecutors opposed his request for compassionate release from prison due to terminal kidney failure.

persons.name: Joshua Schulte
persons.context: Accused of leaking classified CIA data to WikiLeaks in 2016 and facing trial; jury deliberations were ongoing with noted discord.

persons.name: Matthew Laroche
persons.context: Prosecutor in the Joshua Schulte case, gave closing arguments describing Schulte as vengeful and full of rage.

persons.name: Sabrina Shroff
persons.context: Defense counsel for Schulte, argued prosecutors had not definitively proven he stole the data.

persons.name: Paul A. Crotty
persons.context: Presiding judge in the Joshua Schulte trial; excused a juror for misconduct and managed jury deliberations.

persons.name: Sylwia Wiesenberg
persons.context: Juror excused from the Schulte trial for looking up information online about a lawyer and reading news articles about the case.

persons.name: Edward Zas
persons.context: Co-counsel for Schulte from the Federal Defenders of New York Inc.

persons.name: David Denton
persons.context: Government attorney in the Joshua Schulte case.

persons.name: Sidhardha Kamaraju
persons.context: Government attorney in the Joshua Schulte case.

persons.name: Lawrence Ray
persons.context: Accused of running a sex cult involving Sarah Lawrence College students, forcing a victim into prostitution, and making nearly $2 million from her.

persons.name: Kevin Fox
persons.context: Judge who ordered Lawrence Ray held without bail.

persons.name: Antonio Nikc
persons.context: Chappaqua businessman who pleaded guilty to tax evasion for using family business accounts to pay over $1.5 million in personal expenses.

persons.name: Nelson S. Roman
persons.context: Judge scheduled to sentence Antonio Nikc.

persons.name: Jim Ligtenberg
persons.context: Prosecutor in the Antonio Nikc tax evasion case.

persons.name: Harvey Weinstein
persons.context: Recently convicted of rape and criminal sexual assault; underwent a heart procedure before transfer to Rikers Island jail.

persons.name: Juda Engelmayer
persons.context: Spokesman who provided information about Weinstein's heart procedure and expected transfer to Rikers.

persons.name: Martin Horn
persons.context: Commented on the conditions at Rikers Island's North Infirmary Command where Weinstein was expected to be housed.

persons.name: William P. Barr
persons.role: Attorney General of the United States
persons.context: Intervened in an immigration asylum case to narrow the definition of torture for asylum seekers, using the 'certification' power.

persons.name: Jeffrey Chase
persons.context: Commented that Barr's intervention in an asylum case warns immigration board members their decisions are being scrutinized.

persons.name: J. Traci Hong
persons.context: Criticized the Trump administration's frequent use of the certification power, describing it as eroding neutrality and due process.

persons.name: Holly Cooper
persons.role: Co-director, Immigration Law Clinic at UC Davis
persons.context: Criticized the Trump administration's immigration court practices as disregarding due process rights.

persons.name: Dana Leigh Marks
persons.role: President emeritus, National Association of Immigration Judges
persons.context: Expressed concern that frequent changes in precedent from attorney general certifications create confusion for judges.

connections.description: Both are co-executors of Jeffrey Epstein's estate, working together to administer the estate and the victims' compensation fund.
George, as AG of the US Virgin Islands, placed liens on Epstein's assets and negotiated the release of those assets for a victims' fund.
Berman, as U.S. Attorney, prosecuted Akparanta for sexually abusing inmates and issued a statement on his guilty plea.
Shroff is the defense attorney representing Schulte in his trial for leaking classified information to WikiLeaks.
Laroche is the prosecutor leading the case against Schulte, arguing he acted out of vengeance.
Ray is described as a former friend of disgraced NYPD Commissioner Bernie Kerik (mentioned in passing).

events.title: US Virgin Islands AG agrees to release Epstein estate liens
events.description: US Virgin Islands Attorney General Denise George agrees to release liens on Jeffrey Epstein's assets to allow a victims' compensation fund to proceed, pending certain enhancements to the claims program.

events.title: MCC lockdown enters day 8
events.description: The Metropolitan Correctional Center in Manhattan remains on lockdown for an eighth day due to an investigation into a possible smuggled gun, denying inmates access to lawyers and basic amenities.

events.title: Colin Akparanta pleads guilty to sexual abuse
events.description: Former MCC correctional officer Colin Akparanta pleads guilty to sexually abusing at least seven female inmates between 2012 and 2018.

events.title: DOJ opposes Madoff compassionate release
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's office for the SDNY opposes Bernard Madoff's request for compassionate release from his 150-year prison sentence despite his terminal kidney failure.

events.title: Juror excused in Joshua Schulte trial
events.description: Judge Paul A. Crotty excuses juror Sylwia Wiesenberg from the Joshua Schulte trial for misconduct after she looked up a lawyer online and read news articles about the case.

events.title: Lawrence Ray bail hearing
events.description: Accused sex trafficker Lawrence Ray is ordered held without bail after prosecutors allege he made nearly $2 million from a victim forced into prostitution.

events.title: Antonio Nikc pleads guilty to tax evasion
events.description: Chappaqua businessman Antonio Nikc pleads guilty to tax evasion for using family business accounts to pay over $1.5 million in personal expenses.

events.title: Harvey Weinstein heart procedure
events.description: Harvey Weinstein undergoes a heart procedure to implant a stent after experiencing high blood pressure and palpitations following his rape conviction.

events.title: Barr narrows asylum torture definition
events.description: Attorney General William Barr intervenes in an immigration asylum case to narrow the definition of torture for asylum seekers, using his certification power.

Bellevue Hospital Center, New York City
keyFacts: The US Virgin Islands Attorney General agreed to release liens on Jeffrey Epstein's $634 million estate to allow a victims' compensation fund to proceed, pending program enhancements.
The Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) was on an 8-day lockdown due to an investigation into a possible smuggled gun, severely limiting inmate access to lawyers and basic services.
Former MCC correctional officer Colin Akparanta pleaded guilty to sexually abusing at least seven female inmates between 2012 and 2018.
The Justice Department opened a criminal investigation into potential misconduct by guards and contraband flow at the MCC, where Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide.
Attorney General William Barr used his certification power to narrow the definition of torture for asylum seekers, a move criticized by immigration judges and lawyers as eroding due process.
